Course Outcomes.CO1: Implement a dataflow analysis using Soot static analyzer.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Use a symbolic execution tool to generate test cases.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Use a symbolic execution tool to generate test cases.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Develop aspects to analyze a program dynamically.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Classic problems in static program analysis, monotone data flow framework including lattice concepts, control flow graph, pointer analysis, analysis with Soot.
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment to implement basic dataflow analyses using Soot.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to advanced topics including interprocedural analysis and symbolic execution.
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment involving an implementation of a simple interprocedural dataflow analysis using Soot. Another assignment will involve using a symbolic execution tool to generate test cases.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Runtime monitoring concepts, finite state properties, aspects, security automata.
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment to implement runtime monitors using aspects.

Textbook: Principles of Program Analysis by Nielson, Nielson and Hankin.
